sentences: Ta on 체ks nutikas, asjalik, lahe, m천nus vend.
context: In Estonian, 'vend' has multiple meanings: 1) A male sibling (brother), with genitive form 'venna'; 2) A general term for a man or young person, similar to 'guy' or 'dude' in English; 3) Someone from the same group or community, like a fellow countryman. The word can be used literally for family relationships or more casually as a general address to males.
